intro: Hermannia wilmsii, commonly known as the red-stemmed hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Hermannia wilmsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade.
